ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.map

Class MapImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ir.taghizadeh.tehran.dependencies.map.MapImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback, com.makesense.labs.curvefit.interfaces.OnCurveDrawnCallback, Map

    public class MapImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback, Map, com.makesense.labs.curvefit.interfaces.OnCurveDrawnCallback

    MapImpl

    The main logic about Google Maps is done here and we can have access to these methods with Map interface which is injected into MapModuleActivity.

    Since:
    2019-01-07
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Taghizadeh Gevari

      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        By implementing OnMapReadyCallback it waits for googleMap to get ready and when it's done, first it sets a theme on map, then it creates a new CurveManager to draw curves for us and finally sends a signal that map is ready and we can continue our tasks.
        Specified by:
        onMapReady in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
        Parameters:
        googleMap - This is an instance of googleMap when it gets ready to use.

      • setOnMapListener

        public void setOnMapListener(com.google.android.gms.maps.SupportMapFragment mapFragment,
                             Map.MapListener mapListener)
        It captures SupportMapFragment and asks to create a new instance of map with that and by doing that it triggers onMapReady and passes that instance of map.
        Specified by:
        setOnMapListener in interface Map
        Parameters:
        mapFragment - This includes the ID of the fragment in our UI where we want to implement a map.

      • startCamera

        public void startCamera(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng position,
                        int zoom)
        First it animates the camera to a certain LatLng. Then it listens for two events: 1 - When camera starts moving, it simply clears the map to refresh the screen. 2 - When camera stops moving (idle state), it sends a signal and the app executes its queries or it does some tasks with this particular position.
        Specified by:
        startCamera in interface Map
        Parameters:
        position - This position will be the center of the screen after camera starts moving.
        zoom - Indicates the zoom level.
